Champions League
OL - Benfica: Rayan Cherki, close to a record!
Conceived by Rudi Garcia for the reception of Benfica in the Champions League, Rayan Cherki could become the youngest player in the history of the competition, if he plays.
05 Nov 2019, 07:20 by Charlie Creteur



Since the inauguration of Rudi Garcia at the head of Olympique Lyonnais, the attacking midfielder of the Rhone club Rayan Cherki is often summoned to the first team. For the fourth day of the Champions League, the name of the latter is among those 18 players called for the second confrontation against Benfica. Moreover, if Cherki comes into play tomorrow, he will enter the history of the competition.




The youngest player in the history of the C1?




Will Rayan Cherki remain on the bench against Benfica? +9 üì∑Credit Photo - Icon Sport

According to the team's information, Rayan Cherki could become at 16 years, 2 months and 19 days, the youngest player in the history of the Champions League. Thus, he succeeds Celestine Babayaro who holds this record since November 1994 with Anderlecht. He had at that time, 16 years, 2 months and 25 days. It remains to be seen if Rudi Garcia will bring him into play during the meeting ...
